intro: Rapanea paramensis, commonly known as the Paramo rapanea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and paramo ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
